text.sentence: Energy | North America Oil Services and Drilling twenty four April two thousand fourteen

Initiatives Paying Off: Cameron continues to execute on its strategic initiatives and, after demonstrating solid results in oneQ, we expect a further improvement in profitability for the remainder of this year.

CAM is leveraging its restructuring efforts to good effect; additional liquidity from non core business divestitures is being directed to the ongoing buyback program and internal cost initiatives are improving margins in the DPS segment.

While the trajectory for new orders in two thousand fourteen is subdued relative to last year's growth, we think demand will gain momentum as the year progresses, particularly for surface equipment; we also see upside to our outlook for subsea orders depending on the timing on deepwater awards towards the end of the year.

With a positive margin trajectory poised to take hold for the remainder of the year, an aggressive share buyback program underway and the possibility of additional non core asset divestitures looming, we think CAM offers a compelling buying opportunity.
The earnings beat relative to our expectations was largely driven by results in the DPS segment where revenue exceeded our forecast and EBITDA margins of fourteen.six
Total EBITDA of dollar three hundred thirty eight million beat our dollar three hundred twenty five million estimate.

New Guidance Reflects Positive Impact of the Ongoing Buyback Program: CAM repurchased roughly fifteen million shares during the quarter and finished oneQ with dollar four hundred twenty million remaining under its current buyback authorization.
The company is forecasting a share count of two hundred seven million for twoQfourteen fourQfourteen .
The reduced share base is the dominant driver of CAM's updated EPS guidance for two thousand fourteen.

Raising Estimates and Price Target: We are adjusting our two thousand fourteenE and two thousand fifteenE EPS estimates to dollar three.ninety
five and dollar four.eighty reflecting a lower share count going forward.
We are increasing our price target to dollar eighty seven from dollar eighty two.

CAM is levered to several key secular trends which are likely to drive growth in the years to come, including the ongoing new offshore rig construction cycle, the retrofitting of offshore BOP equipment, and accelerating demand for subsea equipment globally.
Near term challanges have been a headwind to earnings growth, but the secular story remains intact.
Our upside case of dollar ninety nine is based on an upside multiple of eighteen.sevenx
In a more robust environment in North America and assuming a more accelerated pickup in international spending we think the company could earn dollar five. to dollar five.thirty per share.
A stalling of the global economy or geopolitical issues could have a negative impact on demand for oil and gas, and consequently oil services.
Under this scenario we think EPS for CAM could be dollar three.thirty

Cameron continues to execute on its strategic initiatives and, after demonstrating solid results in oneQ, we expect a further improvement in profitability for the remainder of this year.

CAM is leveraging its restructuring efforts to good effect; additional liquidity from non core business divestitures is being directed to the ongoing buyback program and internal cost initiatives are improving margins in the DPS segment.

While the trajectory for new orders in two thousand fourteen is subdued relative to last year's growth, we think demand will gain momentum as the year progresses, particularly for surface equipment; we also see upside to our outlook for subsea orders depending on the timing on deepwater awards towards the end of the year.

With a positive margin trajectory poised to take hold for the remainder of the year, an aggressive share buyback program underway and the possibility of additional non core asset divestitures looming, we think CAM offers a compelling buying opportunity.
From the results we excluded a number of one time items, including a goodwill impairment, severance and restructuring costs and a loss from discontinued operations .
The earnings beat relative to our expectations was largely driven by results in the DPS segment where revenue and margins exceeded our forecast.
Total EBITDA of dollar three hundred thirty eight million beat our dollar three hundred twenty five million estimate.
Total revenue of dollar two thousand four hundred thirty two million decreased seventeen percent sequentially but was higher than our dollar two thousand three hundred eighty eight million estimate.
EBITDA of dollar three hundred thirty eight million fell twenty four percent from the previous quarter but beat our estimate of dollar three hundred twenty five million.
percent declined from fifteen.one percent in fourQthirteen but was above our thirteen.six
New orders of dollar two.five billion declined twenty five percent sequentially, and fell short of our dollar three.one billion estimate.
The shortfall was most pronounced in the DPS segment which posted new orders of dollar one.eight billion vs. our dollar two.three billion forecast.
The company provided a robust outlook for orders going forward, highlighting increased demand from North America and the continued development of deepwater projects.
We have tempered our overall order estimate for the company reflecting a more muted outlook for drilling awards as two thousand fourteen progresses.
A better order flow for surface systems should partially offset the drop off.
Subsea orders will likely be the determining factor in CAM's order total for two thousand fourteen driven by the timing of potential deepwater awards late in the year.
Our total order forecast moves to dollar eleven billion which represents an eleven percent annual decline from two thousand thirteen order levels.

CAM repurchased ~fifteen million shares during the quarter for dollar nine hundred twenty six million and had dollar four hundred twenty million remaining on its buyback authorization at the end of the period.
The company expects to reduce its average share count further and is anticipated two hundred seven million shares for twoQfourteen fourQfourteen.
CAM finished oneQ with slightly more than dollar one billion in cash and short term investments.

Revenue for the Drilling and Production Systems business of dollar one thousand seven hundred five million decreased twelve percent sequentially but was higher than our dollar one thousand six hundred twenty three million forecast.
EBITDA of dollar two hundred forty nine million fell twenty two percent from the previous quarter but beat our dollar two hundred thirty one million estimate.
percent declined from sixteen.four percent in fourQthirteen but was above our estimate of fourteen.two
percent and higher than CAM's previously guided oneQ range of thirteen.five
DPS orders of dollar one.eight billion declined over thirty five percent sequentially.

The oneQ total included Drilling orders of dollar five hundred eighty five million, flat sequentially, and Drilling aftermarket orders of dollar two hundred thirty two million, down three percent sequentially.
Segment backlog at dollar nine.three billion declined from dollar nine.five billion in fourQ.

Surface Systems secured dollar five hundred ninety seven million in orders, up eleven percent sequentially while Subsea orders totalled dollar three hundred forty five million, a sixty percent decline from fourQ.
The order outlook for surface systems is clearly improving, led by ramping activity levels in the NAM land basins, which we expect will persist into next year.
The outlook for subsea is positive, though the timing of new awards is uncertain.
We think momentum for subsea order flow will pick up in the back half of the year with the potential for several large awards to materialize depending on the pace of deepwater project advancement.
Drilling orders will likely remain muted; we are anticipating a year over year decline in drilling awards for CAM this year.

We have revised our total order forecast for DPS lower, to ~ dollar seven.six billion in two thousand fourteenE, which represents a decline of roughly twelve percent from two thousand thirteen levels, to account for the subdued demand for drilling equipment and the uncertainty around timing for large subsea orders.
Valves and Measurements revenue of dollar four hundred ninety two million decreased seven percent sequentially and was lower than our dollar five hundred nineteen million estimate.
EBITDA at dollar one hundred six million fell seven percent from the prior period and missed our dollar one hundred ten million forecast.
percent in the previous quarter but was above our twenty one.two
V and M orders of dollar five hundred thirty six million were up roughly two percent from fourQ.
Backlog for the segment increased slightly to dollar one.five billion from dollar one.two billion in the previous quarter.
The margin outlook is stable at ~twenty one twenty two percent which is consistent with recent periods.
Revenue for the Process and Compression Systems business of dollar two hundred thirty four million decreased fifty percent sequentially and missed our dollar two hundred forty six million forecast.
EBITDA of dollar twenty three million fell sixty nine percent from the previous quarter but missed our dollar twenty seven million estimate.
The margin at nine.eight percent declined from fifteen.six percent in fourQthirteen and was below our ten.eight
CAM expects relatively similar results for the business in twoQ followed by improving margins later in the year.
two thousand fourteenE revenue is expected to be dollar one dollar one.one
The company is pursuing strategic alternatives for its remaining compression businesses and we think an additional divestiture could be announced in the coming months.
We are adjusting our two thousand fourteenE and two thousand fifteenE EPS estimates to dollar three.ninety
five and dollar four.eighty reflecting a lower share count going forward.
We are increasing our price target to dollar eighty seven from dollar eighty two.
Our dollar eighty seven price target is based on eighteen.twox
Our price target multiple represents a ten percent premium to the oil service group's target multiple of sixteen.fivex.
Our old price target of dollar eighty two was based on eighteen.twox
our previous two thousand fifteenE EPS estimate of dollar four.fifty.

Guide to the Barclays Fundamental Equity Research Rating System: Our coverage analysts use a relative rating system in which they rate stocks as Overweight, Equal Weight or Underweight relative to other companies covered by the analyst or a team of analysts that are deemed to be in the same industry .
In addition to the stock rating, we provide industry views which rate the outlook for the industry coverage universe as Positive, Neutral or Negative .
A rating system using terms such as buy, hold and sell is not the equivalent of our rating system.
Investors should carefully read the entire research report including the definitions of all ratings and not infer its contents from ratings alone.
Stock Rating Overweight The stock is expected to outperform the unweighted expected total return of the industry coverage universe over a twelve month investment horizon.
Equal Weight The stock is expected to perform in line with the unweighted expected total return of the industry coverage universe over a twelvemonth investment horizon.
Underweight The stock is expected to underperform the unweighted expected total return of the industry coverage universe over a twelve month investment horizon.

Rating Suspended The rating and target price have been suspended temporarily due to market events that made coverage impracticable or to comply with applicable regulations and/or firm policies in certain circumstances including where the Corporate and Investment Banking Division of Barclays is acting in an advisory capacity in a merger or strategic transaction involving the company.
Neutral industry coverage universe fundamentals/valuations are steady, neither improving nor deteriorating.

Guide to the Barclays Research Price Target: Each analyst has a single price target on the stocks that they cover.
The price target represents that analyst's expectation of where the stock will trade in the next twelve months.
Upside/downside scenarios, where provided, represent potential upside/potential downside to each analyst's price target over the same twelve month period.
Guide to the POINT® Quantitative Equity Scores: The POINT Quantitative Equity Scores are based on consensus historical data and are independent of the Barclays fundamental analysts' views.
Each score is composed of a number of standard industry metrics.
These scores are valid as of the date of this report.

Risks which May Impede the Achievement of the Barclays Research Price Target: A material change in commodity prices would alter our earnings outlook and potentially our stance on the entire oil service and drilling sector.
Commodity price changes could be affected by a change in the economic climate, gas storage levels, OPEC behavior, increasing non OPEC oil production, and international political and economic risks.
